instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.820-2796: What is 820-2796? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Noob question
threads.message:
Hi, i am diagnosing macbook air, it have no pp3v42 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
my question is that can <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> present without pp3v42? 
initially <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was present but then when i replaced lt3470a and powered board on, smoke came out of l7030 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stopped working, since then i have removed lt3470a and replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> but still <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is stuck at .80 volts

threads.title: Noob question
threads.message:
Never change any piece without measure the board.

Check now for short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42 lines.
If no short at all, post <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> voltages.

Maybe you can tell us which board you have on the desk...

threads.title: Noob question
threads.message:
Its <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
I will post voltages in few hours.
There's no short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> but i have noticed that pin 23/24 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> have very low resistance and multi-meter beeps on diode mode. I have replaced chip and <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> but nothing changed

threads.title: Noob question
threads.message:
"pin 23/24 of [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/isl6259ahrtz.html"]<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>[/URL] have very low resistance and multi-[URL="http://amzn.to/2jnkPIx"]meter[/URL] beeps on diode mode"
Do you mean with ground, or between 23-24?

Be aware beep is not equal short.
Multimeters beep until 060-075 indication on buzer/diode mode, depending of model...

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42 are independent rails.

threads.title: Noob question
threads.message: It beeps between 23 and 24 and its beeps continuously and value does not climb

threads.title: Noob question
threads.message:
That means <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> detects a problem with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and short G-S of <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>, to protect the system.
That "short" will normally disappear in time.
If <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is shorted (beeps) D-S too, then is burnt...,
